nodes.bodyText: Should not the new constant be called CONTEXT?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -103,7 +104,7 @@
 
     private enum EncodingFrom
     {
-        NOT_SET, INFERRED, SET_LOCALE, SET_CONTENT_TYPE, SET_CHARACTER_ENCODING
+        NOT_SET, INFERRED, SET_LOCALE, SET_CONTENT_TYPE, SET_CHARACTER_ENCODING, DEFAULT

nodes.bodyText: I'm removing the constant, as we never set the encoding on the response explicitly if it is via the context default.

+        NOT_SET, INFERRED, SET_LOCALE, SET_CONTENT_TYPE, SET_CHARACTER_ENCODING, DEFAULT

+package org.eclipse.jetty.server;
+
+
+import org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler;
+
+/**
+ * ContextHandler for testing that implements some
+ * CharEncoding methods from the servlet spec.
+ *

nodes.bodyText:
Is there a reason these fields and methods have "default" in their name?
I would just called them without "default" as they are in ServletContext.

I'm disinclined to change the name. The "default" arises from the fact that it is the default for the context. Without "default" in the name, where the getters are accessed, it gets very confusing with so many different sources of character encoding flying around, so I like that it is obvious that it is the default only.

It is not the default for the context, it is the default for the requests or the responses. This is the only place "default" is used.
It is not used in ServletContext, it is not used in web.xml, it is not used in StandardDescriptorProcessor, and not even used in test method names, so I don't see any reason to change a name used in so many other places and add "default" (which really adds no additional clarity) in just this place.
